page.title: 17ECOLOGY
page.content: { }Most of the area consists of open farmland, with large fields divided by hedges.Exceptions are Gamston and Eaton Woods. These ancient deciduous parish woods cover 160 acres. They are owned by the Nottinghamshire Trust for Natue Conservation and are a nature reserve.Part of Gamston Wood is a site of Special Scientific Interest. Both wods are valuable wildlife sites rich in bird life and flowers.Gamston Wood is said to cotain the richest woodland flora in the county.Two Manpower Service Commission teams are working in the woods,hedging,ditching and coppicing. A public footpath runs through Eaton Wood. Gamston Wood is open to members of the Trust only. The area has a low rainfall.Winters are usually mild with little snowfall. What pollution there is probably comes from the power stations on the R.Trent
